actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 5:00 p.m. on January 9, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Scalise moved that the House do now adjourn.

Since the rules of the 118th Congress had not yet been adopted, the Chair announced the rights of Members to introduce bills, and the authority of the Speaker to refer them, would be delayed and that submitted bills would be held until adoption of the rules. At that time, they would be referred as expeditiously as possible to the appropriate committee and the bills which were not referred and did not appear in the Record as of that day would be included in the next day's Record and printed with a date as of the time that the rules were adopted.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 4 — "Authorizing the Clerk to inform the President of the election of the Speaker and the Clerk."
Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced that the current whole number of the House was 434.

Pursuant to H. Res. 3, the Chair announced the Speaker's appointment of the following Members to the committee on the part of the House to join a committee on the part of the Senate to notify the President of the United States that a quorum of each House has assembled and that Congress is ready to receive any communication that he may be pleased to make: Mr. Scalise of Louisiana, and Mr. Jeffries of New York. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 3 — "Authorizing the Speaker to appoint a committee to notify the President of the assembly of the Congress."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 2 — "Inform the Senate that a quorum of the House has assembled and election of the Speaker and the Clerk."

actions-list.header: ADMINISTRATION OF THE OATH OF OFFICE
actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker administered the Oath of Office to the Officers of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the remainder of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the Aguilar amendment; Failed by voice vote.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Aguilar,  to elect officers of the House
On agreeing to that portion electing the Chaplain Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Aguilar demanded that the question be divided on the adoption of the resolution as to have a separate vote on the election of the Chaplain. Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1 — "Electing officers of the House of Representatives."

Mr. Aguilar of California notified the House that, at the direction of the Democratic Caucus, Mr. Jeffries of New York had been elected Minority Leader, and that Ms. Clark of Massachusetts had been elected as Minority Whip.

Ms. Stefanik of New York notified the House that, at the direction of the Republican Conference, Mr. Scalise of Louisiana had been elected as Majority Leader and Mr. Emmer of Minnesota had been elected as Majority Whip.

actions-list.header: ADMINISTRATION OF THE OATH OF OFFICE
actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker administered the Oath of Office to the Members-elect of the 118th Congress.

actions-list.header: ADMINISTRATION OF THE OATH OF OFFICE
actions-list.actionItem: The Dean of the House administered the Oath of Office to the Speaker-elect.
The Speaker-elect addressed the House prior to taking the Oath of Office which will be administered by the Dean of the House, Representative-elect Harold Rogers, Kentucky.
The Speaker-elect was escorted into the Chamber by the Escort Committee and introduced by Representative-elect Jeffries, Democratic Leader, before assuming the Chair.
The Clerk appointed a Committee of Members-elect to escort the Speaker-elect into the Chamber and to the Chair.
Election of the Speaker. Mr. McCarthy 216, Mr. Jeffries 212, and Present 6 (Roll no. 20). Mr. McCarthy was elected Speaker.

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk directed the Reading Clerk to call the roll anew. Accordingly, the Honorable Bruce Westerman of Arkansas placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Dean Phillips of Minnesota placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.

actions-list.header: On motion to adjourn Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 155
actions-list.actionItem: 279 (Roll no. 19).
Mr. McHenry moved that the House do now adjourn.

actions-list.header: ANNOUNCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 18
actions-list.actionItem: The Clerk announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.
Election of the Speaker. Mr. McCarthy 216, Mr. Jeffries 212, Mr. Jordan 2, Mr. Biggs 2, and Present 2 (Roll no. 18).

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk directed the Reading Clerk to call the roll for the Election of the Speaker. Accordingly, the Honorable Patrick T. McHenry of North Carolina placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Pete Aguilar of California placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.
The Clerk led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Clerk announced approval of the Journal.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 p.m. on January 6, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 17).
Mr. Scalise moved that the House do now adjourn.

actions-list.header: ANNOUCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 16
actions-list.actionItem: The Clerk announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk directed the Reading Clerk to call the roll for the Election of the Speaker. Accordingly, the Honorable James Comer of Kentucky placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Veronica Escobar of Texas placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.

actions-list.header: ANNOUCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 15
actions-list.actionItem: The Clerk announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.
Election of the Speaker. Mr. McCarthy 213, Mr. Jeffries 211, Mr. Jordan 4, and Mr. Hern 3 (Roll no. 15).

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk directed the Reading Clerk to call the roll for the Election of the Speaker. Accordingly, the Honorable Mike Garcia of California placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, the Honorable James E. Clyburn of South Carolina placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker, the Honorable Matt Gaetz of Florida placed the name of the Honorable Jim Jordan into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Lauren Boebert placed the name of the Honorable Kevin Hern into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.
Ms. Stefanik made a point of order that a quorum was not present. Accordingly, Members-elect were counted and the Clerk announced that 275 Members-elect being counted, a quorum was present.
The Clerk led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Clerk announced approval of the Journal.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
